page.title: 19Bats in Ceres
page.content:
Although pipistrelle bats are often seen in Ceres little was known of them until a recent survey, carried out by The University of St Andrews, led to the discovery that their nursery area was in the attic of Woodburne Cottage, Ceres.
Anna Hutton, a former pupil of Ceres School, who lives in the cottage, took part in the survey and counted over 90 bats leaving a small opening above her bedroom window.
She and her mother say that they are proud to have these visitors share their roof and that they cause no trouble at all.
